laboratory_examinations.findings: Hypocalcemia (total serum calcium 5.94 mg/dL), hypomagnesemia (1.41 mg/dL), hyperphosphatemia (10.48 mg/dL), low parathyroid hormone levels (2.3 pg/mL); liver and kidney function tests were normal, with no inflammation markers; hypercalciuria and hypophosphaturia were present.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum magnesium, phosphate, alkaline phosphatase, and calcium levels normalized, and the calciumâ€“phosphorus product was reduced during hospitalization.
